title: Imran liar, hypocrite, stole elections: Marriyum
content:
Minister for Information and Broadcasting Marriyum Aurangzeb Thursday said Imran Khan was a liar, hypocrite, and thief who stole elections and now was taking out his anger on the Chief Election Commissioner due to the foreign funding case against him.
In reaction to the statement of Chairman Pakistan Tehreek I Insaf (PTI) Imran Khan, she said Imran used money to steal votes in the election of 2018 and then in the elections of Senate, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Gilgit Baltistan, Azad Kashmir and Daska in Punjab.
She said buying of loyalties was the political handiwork of Imran Khan, adding his members in assemblies expressed their lack of confidence in him.
She said Chief Election Commissioner Sikandar Sultan was not former chairman National Accountability Bureau (NAB) Javed Iqbal, who would succumb to the blackmailing and threats of Imran.
Imran was asking for an NRO from the Chief Election Commissioner, she remarked.
Imran Khan wanted to become prime minister, chief election commissioner, chairman NAB, chief justice of Pakistan, director general FIA and IG Police all at once, she added.
The minister said one should understand the difference between the vote of no confidence and the buying and selling of votes.
